scrape.title: The dinner
scrape.author: Eileen Everly
scrape.text: much has been made by critics about the unlikeability of the characters in the book. and at first, i wasn't feeling they were all that unlikeable. but by the end of the book, WOW. these people are not at all the kind of folks i like to spend my time reading about, but there was still something compelling in the story. it was interesting to watch their logic, justifications and self-promoting belief system evolve. i would like to say they are in denial, but no, that would imply some form of insight and avoidance of the depths of their despicableness. it was definitely eye opening, reading outside my comfort zone in this way.
